sentences.sContent: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.sCn: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.sContent: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.sCn: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

sentences.sContent: ...a robot has to identify the players...

...Imagine how intimidating it can be for prospective students unfamiliar with the complexities of higher education to navigate this kind of information and then identify which schools are the best fit...
...learning to identify the authenticity of information online is the most practical measure...
...Wren the Pew Research Center recently asked American parents to identify their "ideal" life arrangement...
...scientists can use an IDP to identify and navigate an effective career path...
...trainees report a need for additional resources to help them identify a long-term career path and complete an IDP...
...witnesses sometimes see photographs of several suspects before they try to identify the person they saw in a lineup of people...
...using innovative tools to identify kids with sophisticated verbal skills...

synos.tran: 确定；[计]识别；使参与；把…看成一样

words.tran: 被识别的；经鉴定的；被认同者
可辨认的；可认明的；可证明是同一的
可辨认地；可看作是相同地
身份；同一性，一致；特性；恒等式
鉴定，识别；认同；身份证明
标识符，认同者；检验人，鉴定人

trans.tranCn: 认出， 鉴定； 把…等同于
trans.tranOther: to recognize and correctly name someone or something
